formattedAddress: 16 Bank St, New York, NY 10014, USA
adrFormatAddress: 16 Bank St, New York, NY 10014, USA

editorialSummary.text: High-end renditions of American comfort fare are served with cocktails in a clubby space.

originalText.text: Food gets five stars. Drinks look amazing but have zero taste. I was very disappointed with the Paloma and ended up just ordering a shot of tequila to add to it.

text.text: Food gets five stars. Drinks look amazing but have zero taste. I was very disappointed with the Paloma and ended up just ordering a shot of tequila to add to it.

originalText.text:
Living in the neighborhood full or part-time since it’s hay day back in the mid 2000s, it is disappointing what the Waverly has turned into.

It used to be a spot where you could count on good food, cozy, reasonably decent crowd (unless you’re there on a tourist/B&T heavy night). Unfortunately now much like everywhere in New York these days, it is lacking with not at all New York crowd, dumpy unknowledgeable servers and staff who likely don’t even know what the West Village was pre Covid and commute in every day. Perfect example is the attached photo of the “maître d” - an awkward very rude and dumpy kid (his Hawaiian shirt sadly not captured, taken during the normally busy December holiday season, you can see how busy it was when the late hour of 9 PM hit from this photo, illustrative that it is just for bridge and tunnelers and tourists these days). staff have been told us that they would never have been hired there two years ago, which was already well passed it going downhill.

The food and the drinks are no longer good, they didn’t even have blue cheese stuffed olives (having been disappointed with other drinks and wine we’ve ordered on other visits in the last year, ordered basic martinis - it isn’t hard to make a decent martini - olives aside - and we saw them pour water into the martinis, but said nothing having already dealt with the rude and awkward host, so not desiring another fight with a rude B&T staff member, just tipped less and called it a loss).

Such a shame and unfortunately we don’t see this venue or New York going back to what it once was anytime soon.

originalText.text: The ambiance, food, and service were perfection! A lovely place for a date or dinner with friends. Look forward to going back.

text.text: The ambiance, food, and service were perfection! A lovely place for a date or dinner with friends. Look forward to going back.

originalText.text: I like the banana desert. The summer truffle does not have much taste. I love the beet salad. Apple crumble desert is unacceptable: not fresh and tasteless. Garden smells very pleasant. I enjoy dining in the garden. Service does not feel quite attentive and warm

text.text: I like the banana desert. The summer truffle does not have much taste. I love the beet salad. Apple crumble desert is unacceptable: not fresh and tasteless. Garden smells very pleasant. I enjoy dining in the garden. Service does not feel quite attentive and warm

originalText.text:
The food is not at all worth the price. Roughly $250+ for 2 adults and 1 child, 1 appetizer and no dessert or drinks. A cheeseburger, a strip steak and a pot pie. Fried rizzoto balls for starter. Steak was average, pot pie was average and the burger was not good. Came out wrong and had to ask for it to be fixed with no apology.

I guess you pay for the "ambiance". Personally I don't enjoy being literally squeezed up against my neighboring table. There's virtually no room to even put your coat on the back of your chair. We had to physically try and scoot our table over so that another table could be sat next to us. I also noticed several "looks" from other guests for having a child with us(10). It was our family dinner on our family vacation.

There's definitely much better places to try but if you've got that kind of money then you probably don't care anyway.
